titlestmt.titleproper: UCLA University Archives. Biographical files (Reference Collection).
Biographical files (UCLA University Archives Reference Collection). 1882- UARC.0745
titlestmt.author: University Archives staff, 2005 July; finding aid revised by Charlotte B. Brown, 2013 September; machine-readable finding aid created by Katharine A. Lawrie, 2013 October; additional EAD encoding by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 30 March 2017.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-01 10:26:55 -0700.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: Undetermined, Code for undetermined script script.

did.unittitle: UCLA University Archives. Biographical files (Reference Collection).
did.abstract: Record Series 745 contains biographical information and photographs of faculty and staff affiliated with: the Los Angeles State Normal School (LASNS), 1881-1919; the University of California, Southern Branch, 1919-1926; the University of California, Los Angeles, 1927- . Materials include curriculum vitae, photographs, press releases, and newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance through our electronic paging system using the "Request items" button.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Copyright of portions of this collection has been assigned to The Regents of the University of California. The UCLA University Archives can grant permission to publish for materials to which it holds the copyright. All requests for permission to publish or quote must be submitted in writing to the UCLA University Archivist.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Sources for the Biographical Files (Reference Collection) include: UCLA Emeriti Center, UCLA faculty files, and the administrative files of UCLA offices and departments.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Biographical files (UCLA University Archives Reference Collection) (University Archives Record Series 745). UCLA Library Special Collections, University Archives.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: UCLA Catalog Record ID: 9973991483606533

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The UCLA University Archives reference collection of biographical files was created ca.1986 and contain information on: faculty and staff of the Los Angeles State Normal School (LASNS), 1881-1919; faculty and staff of the University of California, Southern Branch, 1919-1926; faculty and staff of the University of California, Los Angeles, 1927- .

UCLA Golden Year Committee biographical files (former Record Series 285) are now part of Record Series 745. The Golden Year Committee was formed to commemorate the 50th anniversary of UCLA at the Westwood campus, 1929-1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Record Series 745 contains biographical information and photographs of faculty and staff affiliated with: the Los Angeles State Normal School (LASNS), 1881-1919; the University of California, Southern Branch, 1919-1926; the University of California, Los Angeles, 1927- . Materials include curriculum vitae, photographs, press releases, and newspaper clippings.

UCLA Golden Year Committee biographical files (former Record Series 285) are now part of Record Series 745. The Golden Year Committee was formed to commemorate the 50th anniversary of UCLA at the Westwood campus, 1929-1979.
This is an active Record Series; additional University records are expected to be added.
The collection is organized into the following series:

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

odd.p: UCLA football player; was the first UCLA football player to be designated a consensus All-American; was voted UCLA football team's MVP [most valuable player] in 1939.
